author: sussman
msg: Locking branch:  register an r->pool cleanup to set fs access_ctx to NULL.
We do this because the fs lives in connection->pool, while per-request
access contexts live in r->pool.  Each request might have a different
username or token attached, so when the request dies, so must the
fs's access context.
* mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(struct cleanup_fs_access_baton):  new baton.
(cleanup_fs_access):               new pool cleanup func.
(dav_svn_get_resource):            register the cleanup func with r->pool.

author: sussman
msg: Locking branch:  make mod_dav_svn support generic LOCK/UNLOCK requests.
* mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(get_parent_path):  feedback from philip: add docstring. make sure len > 0.
* mod_dav_svn/lock.c
(dav_svn_create_lock): create with a lockscope and locktype of
UNKNOWN, else dav_svn_parse_lockinfo() chokes on the LOCK request.
(dav_lock_to_svn_lock): do sanity checks, possibly return dav_error.
map dav_lock->auth_user to svn_lock_t->user.
(svn_lock_to_dav_lock): add to-do comment.
(dav_svn_append_locks): update caller of above.
(dav_svn_get_resource):  push incoming lock-token into the fs.
(struct dav_locktoken):  move declaration from here...
* mod_dav_svn/dav_svn.h
(struct dav_locktoken):  ...to here.
